## Description {#details}

Canonicalizer for mangled names.

This class allows specifying a list of &quot;equivalent&quot; manglings. For example, you can specify that Ss is equivalent to NSt3&#95;&#95;112basic&#95;stringIcNS&#95;11char&#95;traitsIcEENS&#95;9allocatorIcEEEE and then manglings that refer to libstdc++&#39;s &#39;std::string&#39; will be considered equivalent to manglings that are the same except that they refer to libc++&#39;s &#39;std::string&#39;.

This can be used when data (eg, profiling data) is available for a version of a program built in a different configuration, with correspondingly different manglings.

Definition at line 35 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-h">ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer.h</a>.

Add an equivalence between <code>First</code> and <code>Second</code>.

Both manglings must live at least as long as the canonicalizer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-h">ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-cpp/#l00207">207</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-cpp">ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer.cpp</a>.

### canonicalize() {#a118854573d453cd9d48aa4d47d467846}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer::Key ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer::canonicalize (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Mangling)</>}>
Form a canonical key for the specified mangling.

They key will be the same for all equivalent manglings, and different for any two non-equivalent manglings, but is otherwise unspecified.

Returns <a href="#a830634afc3321cbb695156f050d16d8c">Key()</a> if (and only if) the mangling is not a valid Itanium C++ ABI mangling.

The string denoted by Mangling must live as long as the canonicalizer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-h/#l00081">81</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-h">ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-cpp/#l00302">302</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/profiledata/itaniummanglingcanonicalizer-cpp">ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lookup() {#a0a2031331b5fe01f7aeea8ea89be858a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer::Key ItaniumManglingCanonicalizer::lookup (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Mangling)</>}>
Find a canonical key for the specified mangling, if one has already been formed.

Otherwise returns <a href="#a830634afc3321cbb695156f050d16d8c">Key()</a>.
